Description: Shoulder sherd of East Greek pottery open vessel, possibly a dinos; white slip; interior glazed; exterior, from top: dotted cross and undetermined motif as filling ornament; wide black band between two narrow dilute lines; cross and part of pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to a hydria or oinochoe, however, the black interior shows that it is from a large open vessel. Chian dinoi are frequently left unslipped on the interior.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 271, no. 695, pl. 91)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.36)
